name: Introduction to Gender & Sexuality Studies
description: This course provides an introduction to theories, debates, and primary texts in the field of Gender & Sexuality Studies.

name: Sexuality & Identity
description: This course examines the ways in which identities are constructed around gender and sexuality, and explores the history and politics of sexuality, and its role in the formation of identities.

name: Gender & Sexuality in Intersectional Contexts
description: This course explores the intersections of gender, race, class, and sexuality, and how they operate through culture, media, and in everyday life.

name: Queer Theory
description: This course introduces students to the theoretical concepts that are used to analyze gender and sexuality, including queer theory, critical race theory, and postcolonial theory.

name: Advanced Topics in Sexuality Studies
description: This course examines advanced topics in the field of Sexuality Studies, including sexology, trans studies, and the medicalization of sex and gender.
